instructions_to_main_agent: Implement the 'Aviation Dark Mode' strictly. No light mode toggles unless requested.
Use 'Rajdhani' font for all headers to give that technical cockpit feel.
Use 'JetBrains Mono' for all data values, IDs, and code snippets.
Ensure all visualizations (Cytoscape, etc.) use the defined semantic colors (Blue for nodes, Green for active, Red for deleted).
The Dashboard should look like a 'Mission Control' center. Use borders, grids, and monospace text.
For the 'Airport Network' (Graph), use Cytoscape.js with a dark style stylesheet.
For 'Passenger Database' (Hash Table), visualize the buckets and chains clearly.
For 'Boarding Queue', use a circular visualization if possible, or a clear linear queue with pointers.
For 'Flight Scheduler' (Min Heap), visualize the binary tree structure.
Add a 'DSA Lab Project' badge in the top right corner of the header.
Ensure all interactive elements have 'data-testid' attributes.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: Do not use generic centered layouts. Use dense, data-rich grids.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy.
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur) for modals and overlays.
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable in content areas, but keep data tables dense.
Subtle grain textures or noise overlays can enhance the 'monitor' feel.
Prioritize using pre-existing components from src/components/ui when applicable.
